topic.title: How to Publish MathML Formulas when Generating WebHelp from a Command Line

body.p: The DITA-OT distribution that comes bundled with Oxygen includes some additional pre-installed DITA-OT plugins that add support for properly displaying MathML formulas in the WebHelp output. However, if you are generating your WebHelp output from a command line, MathML formulas will not be displayed properly unless you install these plugins manually.

These plugins can be downloaded and installed from DITA 1.3 Support for Open Toolkit (https://github.com/dita-community/dita13-dita-ot-1.x-support). This plugin package adds DITA 1.3 Support including MathML.

section.title: How to Add Support for MathML when Generating WebHelp from a Command Line

ol.li: Download and unzip the DITA 1.3 Support for Open Toolkit 1.x distribution package. It includes 4 DITA-OT plugins.
Copy the four plugin directories to your /plugins directory.
In the home directory of your DITA-OT installation, run the ant -f integrator.xml command.
